Texture: Even though colors may have disappeared, objects still have different textures. For example, a rough rock will have a different texture than a smooth pebble.
Shape: Shapes can still be distinguished even if colors are not present. For example, a square will have four corners while a circle will have no corners.
Size: Objects can still be distinguished by their size. For example, a small bird will be smaller than a large bird.
Sound: Objects can also be distinguished by their sound. For example, a wooden chair will make a different sound when sat on than a metal chair.
Light: Even though colors may have disappeared, objects can still be distinguished by the amount of light they reflect. For example, a shiny object will reflect more light than a dull object.
